actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to establish a Conference on the Antitrust Laws.

summary.text: Establishes a Conference on the Antitrust Laws of the United States. Provides for a general membership and a Council of such Conference. Provides that it shall be the purpose of such Conference to: (1) study the operation of existing antitrust laws; (2) study the enforcement procedures of the Department of Justice, the Federal Trade Commission, and other agencies as they relate to the antitrust laws; and (3) make recommendations for improvement in the statutory framework wherever appropriate. Sets forth the duty of the Conference to report to the Congress on its findings and conclusions under this Act. Authorizes the appropriation of such sums as are necessary to carry out this Act.

titles.title: A bill to establish a Conference on the Antitrust Laws.
